intro: Pyrola tokugoensis, commonly known as the Tokugawa pyrola, is a rare and endangered species native to Japan. It is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Ericaceae family, typically found in shaded, moist forest environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, and it has elliptical, leathery leaves. It thrives in acidic soil and is often associated with coniferous forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
